call_title: Ergo PoW Blockchain - Community Chat - October 2nd

topics.title: Welcome and Colorado Meetup Preparation
topics.summary: Opening welcome to the weekly Ergo AMA and discussion of preparations for the upcoming Colorado Springs meetup event. Equipment, streaming setup, and party planning details are shared.

topics.title: USC Stablecoin Development Progress
topics.summary: Kushti reports good progress on USC stablecoin development from developer discussions. Richie will be joining community calls more regularly starting in November.

topics.title: Git Circles Initial Testing Phase
topics.summary: Git circles project is preparing for initial tests this month and will begin reaching out to developer communities. The focus is on building digital economies and financial circles for open source development.

topics.title: Basis Chain Cash Demo and Development
topics.summary: Basis Chain Cash will start demos this month with wallet development beginning. Two phases planned: community trading with off-chain cash backed by Ergo reserves, and agent/robot solutions without wallet requirements.

topics.title: Nautilus Wallet Ledger Fix
topics.summary: Nautilus wallet now has a fix for Ledger hardware wallet integration along with other development updates covered in the dev update.

topics.title: Monero Bridge Development Challenges
topics.summary: Discussion of ongoing work to bridge with Monero, facing challenges due to limited data fields and wallet support requirements. Multiple options are being explored to find user-friendly solutions.

topics.title: Keystone Hardware Wallet Integration
topics.summary: Updates on Keystone hardware wallet integration waiting on AnonBR development work. A design competition for Ergo-branded Keystone devices is being planned.

topics.title: AI Agents for Code Analysis and Development
topics.summary: Kushti discusses using AI agents for code analysis, testing, and development support. AI can help non-developers understand code concepts and combat misinformation, though security-critical main code should remain human-reviewed.

topics.title: USC Oracle Pool V2 Launch
topics.summary: USC oracle pool version 2 has launched with 4 pools running and 12 oracles, with 30 tokens planned. Launch parameters for the bank and LP are being discussed.

topics.title: Ergo Foundation Structure and Responsibilities
topics.summary: Detailed discussion of current EF members and their roles, transition to community-run infrastructure, and the original white paper plan for a 2.5-year bootstrapping period that has already expired. The goal is decentralization away from centralized entities.

topics.title: ErgoDevs DAO and Commercial Development
topics.summary: ErgoDevs DAO has increased bounties from crowdfunding campaigns. Kushti is exploring creating a commercial company similar to Bitcoin's Blockstream model to provide multiple development funding sources and avoid single-party control.

topics.title: Palmyra Platform Cooperation Status
topics.summary: Discussion of Palmyra's real-world assets platform relationship with Ergo. Previous discussions about lithium insurance in Argentina but no recent updates. Ergo's lower fees make it more practical for token creation compared to Cardano.

topics.title: Mining DAO and Chain Governance
topics.summary: Proposal to create a mining DAO using Paideia for chain votes instead of node config changes. Discussion of incentives, on-chain voting records, and involving all mining pools in governance decisions.

topics.title: Privacy Sidechain Capabilities
topics.summary: Ergo has capabilities for launching XMR-like privacy sidechains. Early ideas included DarkFi-based sidechains, but DarkFi is still in development with only early testnet availability.

topics.title: Upcoming Block Reward Reduction and 6.0 Activation
topics.summary: Discussion of the upcoming block reward reduction to single digits and Ergo 6.0 activation in approximately 5 days (3,000-3,500 blocks). These major events need announcement and promotion.

topics.title: Twitter Strategy and Community Outreach
topics.summary: Discussion of improving Twitter/X strategy, automating content from Telegram discussions, involving national language groups, and using ERG-1 community members for tweet creation. Emphasis on educating newcomers about Ergo principles and manifesto.
